channel.title: Can't get this right
channel.description:
Dang, I tried to port forward but I think I failed. The website really didn't help me. My router is under Airlink+ and its AR410W. Can someone please help me, I don't know what to put in the LAN server spot. Heres some pictures: Router+ No-IP: [IMG]http://i68.photobucket.com/albums/i5/hurlywiz/untitled-4.jpg[/img] No-Ip: [IMG]http://i68.photobucket.com/albums/i5/hurlywiz/untitled-8.jpg[/img] And I can't use hamachi so I have to use no-ip because of this error with hamachi
[IMG]http://i68.photobucket.com/albums/i5/hurlywiz/Untitled2-1.gif[/img]
Please help

item.title: Can't get this right
item.dc:creator: @aceeca aceeca
item.description:
@aceeca wrote:

Hey Ill help you with this one. Its really simple once you get it. It took me a long time to get mine to port foward.

Step 1

Open up internet explorer and log into your router.

Step 2

fill in all the info.
Enable it by clicking in the bubble (lol)
Name it anything, just something so you can remeber what it is.
set the protcol to TCP.
set both of the port things to 43594
here is where I think you messed up.

Click start>run(to the right of all programs)>once a window opens type CMD

Ok now a black screen should of opened. If not wait like 10 sec after that type again. Now on the black screen type ipconfig/all some info should of came up look for something called ip addres it should start something like his 192.168. what ever is after that you need to put in the lan server. Don’t put 1.1 because that is the ip addres to log into your router. you need to tell your router what computer on the router to send it to and that is what is after the 192.168 on that black screen.

Now you should be done but just to check open your run server in your server sorce folder. Now go here http://www.utorrent.com/testport.php?port=43594
give it like 5 sec it should now say your good. Make sure your run server thing is on during this because you need something running on the port number to accept the ping to it.

Step 3

No-ip im still working on that I haven’t got it to work myself.
but from the looks of it you have everything right but in the ip box don’t put 192.168.1.1 that is the ip to your router and everyones router in the world starts with 192.168 that just how they made them. you need to put the ip address to your modem. To get that go here www.ipchicken.com its the one in the center of the screen and the biggest one. put that in the ip box on the no ip thing.

step 4

don’t use ham it doesn’t work very well and you should be able to get people on once you get port fowarding done.

Well that it all I know that could help you if you need more help with something let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't get this right
item.dc:creator: @Killed_By_Squirrel Killed By Squirrel
item.description:
@Killed_By_Squirrel wrote:

Your internet I.P. address, not your computer’s pmgz2. It should already be filled in for you when you create a host.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Uh lol, he needs to change the UDP to TCP because moparscape uses TCP not UDP.

item.title: Can't get this right
item.dc:creator: @pmgz2 pmgz2
item.description:
@pmgz2 wrote:

umm wtf? ur portforwarding and thats ham?? anyways the problem is when your in no-ip.com your putting in your routers Ip, put in your Computers Ip address, internal not external.
